topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550234b76368722ad21a0400#post_550234b76368722ad21a0400
Hey you know how a while back we had a fight about pokemon and I made myself look like a ass cause I thought that pokemon shouldn't be that popular and argued that cause other games did monster capture as well that therefore pokemon was bad?  Guess who is doing the equivalent of that now?


Most readers realize that it's a generic harem and that yes it is tenchi muyo with monster girls, *BUT* the current number of anime shows where the premise is about monster girls: 0


Imagine if pokemon was the *ONLY* monster capture game in existence; wouldn't it be super popular in that case?

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5502367e6368724971cc0200#post_5502367e6368724971cc0200
I'm not saying it's bad. I'm saying it's generic. I've read the exact same story in Daily Life a million times before it. And let's not forget that Musume isn't nearly as popular in Japan as it is in America. My point is if you're going to have a harem series, just adding Monster Girls doesn't make it unique.

topics.body:
Just found out that one of my all time favorite authors died today. Terry Pratchett, author of the Discworld novels passed away at his home with his family at the age of 66.

I am unable to communicate properly just how much his books meant to me, how much he's informed my own sensibilities of both comedy and fantasy, all I can do right now is say that the world is poorer place for his loss.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5502371b6368726f66be0100#post_5502371b6368726f66be0100
. . . uhhhhh. . . dude. . . about that. . . You do realize how often things like vampires, mermaids or such are sexualized in the west right?

I mean think about it; in Underworld the entire time you're watching the movie you're watching Kate Beckinson in skintight latex body suits.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: Hell look at Ken Akamatsu second work, Negima. Negima pretty much DROPPED the entire harem angle in the second half in favor of a supernatural action story. Much to the story's benefit.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550237f3636872402a2a0200#post_550237f3636872402a2a0200
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550237b563687262f7950300#post_550237b563687262f7950300
That doesn't change the fact that in Japan things like One Piece regularly outsell it.[/bq]
Dude; just cause shonen is more popular doesn't mean that there isn't a market for monster girls.

By your logic because dances with wolves is the highest grossing movie of all time that therefore all other movies shouldn't have been made.

Other problem with your logic:
Just cause shonen is more popular doesn't mean people have to like it.  That'd be a extremely shitty thing to say that cause shonen is popular that therefore we're not allowed to not like it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55023818636872316f970500#post_55023818636872316f970500
I've lost two of my personal heroes already, first Nimoy and today Pratchett. My one consolation is that both of them didn't exactly go in blind, Pratchett in particular was quite open about death and his struggle with alzheimers.

So?  I think boku no hero academia is generic and average, but I understand why it's popular.

How you think you're coming off as, "Good day sir; I doth thinkest though art be of incorrect pointification towards what be considered quality material for enjoyment"
How you're actually coming off as, "STOP LIKING THINGS THAT AREN'T POPULAR!"

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55023a076368726f27cb0300#post_55023a076368726f27cb0300
I've lost some heroes this year myself. With the sad passing of Nimoy and Robin Williams its been a really rough year for my childhood.

Heck I just lost my Old Dog last Friday. I knew that guy since I was 5 years old. So it was a giant heart breaker to see him go. And especially the way he went.

For me I can at least rest knowing that they are at peace.
